Short Description: DHCS requires a specific "Outreach Tracker File" for members not yet enrolled.
Additional Note:
This is likely a “modularized” entry that captures several fields: 
Outreach Date: (MM/DD/YYYY).
Outreach Attempt Type:
• Values: In-Person, Telephonic, Electronic (Text/Email), Mail, Community Settings.
Outreach Outcome:
• Values: Successful (Member reached), Unsuccessful (Voicemail/No Answer), Declined.
Total Minutes of Outreach: Duration of the attempt.
Staff ID: The NPI or ID of the staff member attempting outreach (this can be done via User_assignment tag).

Short Description: Members must be tagged to one or more of DHCS-defined populations to justify eligibility.
Additional Note:
This can be a boolean selection across one of the multiple POF’s defined by DHCS (e.g. “Individuals experiencing homelessness” or “Severe Mental Illness / Substance Use Disorder”

The system will need to be able to track this historically (e.g. if a patient / client switches POFs, a historical record must be preserved for audit purposes).

Short Description: The name of the “Lead Care Manager” for each patient / client enrolled in ECM
Additional Note: An admin (Manager of ECM services) needs to designate which lead care manager each ECM patient is enrolled with, this is a required field for MCP reporting.

Short Description: Explanation for why a patient / client is no longer receiving ECM services
Additional Note: These must conform to DHCS standard reason codes and are required for reporting to MCPs on a discontinuation of services to a patient / client (e.g., "Member declined," "Unable to contact," "Met goals").

Short Description: Standardized race / ethnicity code
Additional Note: Standardized codes for tracking / reporting / service delivery

Short Description: The plan for navigating a patient from their current homeless status into either interim or permanent housing
Additional Note:
A structured plan developed at / near intake depending on the program the patient / client is enrolled in. The Housing Assistance Plan will include multiple fields and should ensure compliance with the minimum standards outlined by DHCS and the payer (these standards are loosely defined though there are some required fields). The Housing Assistance Plan is required for the Prior Authorization process, and is also a foundational tool for multiple CS service delivery models.

Similar to the care plan, the Housing Assistance Plan will also need to capture certain administrative data for MCP reporting:

Initial Assessment Date: Date the comprehensive assessment was completed.
Completion Date: Date the individualized care plan was signed/finalized.
Update Date: Date of the most recent revision.
Case Manager Information:
• Name.
• Contact Phone/Email.

Short Description: The plan for managing the patient / client’s needs specific to their program enrollment
Additional Note:
A structured plan developed at / near intake depending on the program the patient / client is enrolled in. The care plan will include multiple fields and should ensure compliance with the minimum standards outlined by DHCS and the payer. The Care Plan is required for the Prior Authorization process, and is also a foundational tool for ECM and many CS service delivery models. 

Beyond the service content, this care plan will also need to capture certain administrative dates required for MCP reporting:

Initial Assessment Date: Date the comprehensive assessment was completed.
Care Plan Completion Date: Date the individualized care plan was signed/finalized.
Care Plan Update Date: Date of the most recent revision.
Lead Care Manager (LCM) Information:
• LCM Name.
• LCM Contact Phone/Email.
• LCM NPI (if clinical).

Short Description: Does the CPT Code require authorization?
Additional Note: This is not a required field in a claim, but is essential for general revenue cycle management. Identifying when a service requires a prior authorization is essential and should trigger a parallel prior authorization workflow by, ideally, a single individual inside the organization that will complete two steps: submit the prior authorization request through the payer portal (this is a manual process, unfortunately), and log the prior authorization request details into the prior authorization module inside of DSS’s RCM tool). Once that Prior Auth is then approved, a PA Number and the effective dates for the PA can be updated in the PA module, and the claiming tool will begin to process those claims accordingly (e.g. the submission tool will have held back claims for any service that do not have an active PA).

Short Description: Code used to identify a payer for claims submission interface.
Additional Note: The national payer code used to route claims to the correct payer (e.g. HealthNet claims are submitted to Centene’s NPI unless you are in WA, etc…)

Short Description: M or F
Additional Note: This can be coded any number of ways in the case management system, but back-end logic will need to transform all inputted values into either binary sex of: M or F
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Formerly used for balance due
Field Requirement: Other: Not used currently but reserved for future use or custom use.
Additional Note: Not applicable, this has been deprecated (thanks God).

Short Description: Authorization or referral number
Additional Note: A PA number is essential for certain claims submission, and attaching a PA number and ensuring that claims are only submitted during active dates for PA is something that a billing module in concert with a PA tracking module can manage.

Short Description: When resubmitting a corrected claim
Field Requirement: Dependent: Based on claim resubmission status: use code “7” (replacement) or “8” (void).
Additional Note: This is a field that can be placed by a back-end billing module or solution through the post-submission adjudication process.

Short Description: Check if an external lab performed the test
Field Requirement: Other: If services billed were done by an outside lab.
Additional Note: Not required

Short Description: Notes to payer, drug info, investigational use, etc.
Field Requirement: Other: Payer-specific; used frequently for Medicare or compounding drugs.
Additional Note: Not required

Short Description: Admission and discharge dates
Field Requirement: Other: Required if services relate to inpatient stay.
Additional Note: This is not a required field for ECM, CS or CHW billing, though is a helpful piece of data to capture and may be required at a future data for Post Hospitalization Medical Respite Care. At this point we would recommend capturing this date

Short Description: National Provider Identifier of referring provider
Field Requirement: Dependent: Required if Box 17 is completed.
Additional Note: Linked to the “referring provider name” this is not a required field for ECM, CS, or CHW billing at present, but is likely an important field to capture for analytics or performance tracking purposes.

Short Description: Legacy ID if required by payer
Additional Note: Not necessary, this is a deprecated field by nearly all payers

Short Description: Required when a referral or order is involved
Field Requirement: Dependent: primarily for labs, imaging, therapy, specialist visits.
Additional Note: This is likely unnecessary for claiming purposes, though would represent a leading practice for care coordination and could be useful for analytics purposes (e.g. tracking referral sources) or operational compliance (e.g. “closed loop referral” completions).

Short Description: If patient was unable to work due to condition
Field Requirement: Dependent: For disability claims or work-related injuries.
Additional Note: This is a dependent field that is required for disability claims or worker’s comp claims, though it could be collected at either intake or in clinical notes depending on when an injury occurs. It may be best practice to include this as a “gated” value that is available only if a previous field related to a disability has been activated.

Short Description: Additional relevant dates (e.g., same/similar illness)
Field Requirement: Other: Based on payer rules or specific CPT/ICD usage.
Additional Note: Box 15 captures a secondary date related to the patient's condition or treatment history AND an explanation of what that date is. The explanation, on a claim form is a three-digit code which corresponds to a common set of reasons that can be pre-populated in a drop-down menu (e.g. “Initial Treatment”, “Accident date”, “Last X-Ray”)

Short Description: Indicates whether services were due to employment, auto accident, or other accident
Field Requirement: Dependent: Required for workers’ comp or accident-related claims.
Additional Note: This is likely not required for any Medi-Cal patient, though it could be helpful data to capture for general care coordination / analytics purposes. It is also required for any worker’s compensation claims or any accident-related claims.

Short Description: Full name of secondary plan
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field

Short Description: If secondary insurance is through employer/school
Additional Note: This is likely not required for any Medi-Cal patient, though it could be helpful data to capture for general care coordination / analytics purposes

Short Description: Date of birth and sex of secondary insured
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field

Short Description: Policy number of secondary insurance
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field

Short Description: Name of additional policyholder
Field Requirement: Dependent: If the patient has secondary insurance.
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field
Program: Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Marital status and employment/school status
Field Requirement: Other: Some payers may require for coordination of benefits.
Additional Note: This is likely not required for any Medi-Cal patient, though it could be helpful data to capture for general care coordination / analytics purposes
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Consistent code that can be translated/customized by payer
Additional Note: We have seen drop-down menus for services (e.g. “clinical team consultation” or “individual patient session”) work well. There can be multiple menus attached to the “Program” that the patient or client is enrolled in (e.g. ECM, or Housing Transition and Navigation Services). These values can then be matched against billing codes, modifiers, and rates on the back end for claims submission.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: National Provider Identifier.
Additional Note: This will be the information for whomever your billing provider is (e.g. if it is the Co-Lab it would be our NPI and service address)

Short Description: Name, address, phone number.
Additional Note: This will be the information for whomever your billing provider is (e.g. if it is the Co-Lab it would be our NPI and service address)

Short Description: Start date MM/DD/YYYY
Additional Note: We will need to affix a data of service to any qualifying “encounter” whether its a phone call to patient / client, a consultation with another clinician, etc… These individual service dates may not be required for billing purposes now, but may be needed at a future date, and are necessary for audit purposes (for example, CCAH is now requiring evidence of at least two patient encounters / billing month for housing transition and navigation services).
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Unique CCS system identifier for matching clinical and billing data
Additional Note: Unique CCS system identifier for matching clinical and billing data
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: If any prior payments received.
Additional Note: This would be applicable to any claims that have been “partially paid” and the claim is being resubmitted for either the remainder of the balance or some additional fees attached to the same encounter. This is a function that should be managed by a billing module, or RCM solution.

Short Description: Address where service was delivered
Additional Note: This would be the address for each corresponding POS code
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: ICD-10 codes (up to 12); use letters (A-L) to link to services.
Additional Note: For ECM and CS services, this needs to ultimately be submitted as as “Z-Code” which is based on a social determinant of health as opposed to a traditional clinical health diagnosis. Z-Codes Z-55-65 cover the acceptable Dx codes for ECM and CS service delivery (e.g. Z59.00 = homeless, unspecified, Z59.01 = Sheltered Homeless). An SDOH or HRSN screener will be the best source of these diagnosis codes. This Dx data is needed for both claiming, and also in certain cases (e.g. some ECM patients without a referral and all CS services) for prior authorization submission.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: EIN or SSN of billing entity.
Additional Note: This is the EIN / SSN of the provider facility (in this case, DOH as they hold the contract)

Short Description: Indication that signature is on file (Y / N)
Additional Note: This can likely be collected at the start / end of a providers employment period and kept in an Admin panel
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Required if different from billing.
Additional Note: This will be the service facility that DSS primarily uses and will be populated on each claim as the NPI will be different from DOH.

Short Description: Indication that signature is on file (Y / N)
Additional Note: Required if the patient / client is not the insured individual (this likely will not be the case for Medi-Cal patients as eligibility is individually determined, but should still be an accessible field.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Letter(s) from Box 21 (e.g., A, B).
Additional Note: The Dx pointer is where the claim indicates which procedure (HCPCS/CPT does) is associated with which diagnosis. Pointers are only required for service claims that have multiple diagnosis. Pointer logic should be handled by a billing module or RCM solution based on programmed logic.

Short Description: Required for certain CPTs or ICDs.
Additional Note: Depending on workflow considerations, this could be captured at the front end or in the middle in service notes. A best practice would be to capture it at patient / client registration, so that a prior authorization could be filed immediately for applicable services (e.g. ECM or CS patients without active prior auth)

Short Description: CPT/HCPCS code + any required modifiers.
Additional Note: Qualifying CPT / HCPCS codes and modifiers should be attached to claims based on the details included in the signed provider agreement. Codes will be attached to individual claims files based on the patient / clients active Prior Authorization status and service notes.

Short Description: Sum of all charges from Box 24F.
Additional Note: This is a back-end billing module or RCM solution that calculates the charges across multiple procedures (if the claim includes multiple HCPCS / CPT codes) and affixes the total into the correct claim field (box 28)

Short Description: Check YES to receive payment from insurer.
Additional Note: This will likely always be a “Yes” and is the provider (in this case DOH), telling the payer that they will accept the payers allowed rates, or those outlined in the contract.

Short Description: 2-digit location code
Additional Note: There are likely only two options for this code (e.g. 04 = Homeless Shelter, 27 = Outreach site / street). It is essential that we collect this correctly though, so an option of location should be included for each service note (this also has implications on remote v in person which is specifically captured in another field)
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Unit calculations may vary by service (see notes)
Additional Note: CHW is billed based on a count of 30 minute work unit blocks, Housing Navigation and Tenancy Support is based on a count of any qualifying encounter, tracking ECM “minutes” also represents a leading practice and would be our recommended approach.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Fee for each service line.
Additional Note: Valid CPT codes will be cross-walked with contractually identified rates and claims will be submitted with valid fees attached. This is a function managed by a billing module or RCM solution.

Short Description: Indication that signature is on file (Y / N)
Additional Note: This is a Yes / No answer that will be collected at intake and will need to be re-authorized annually.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: If patient has other coverage.
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Group/policy number of primary insurance.
Additional Note: There are no group policy numbers for Medi-Cal, though this field should likely still exist for future flexibility.

Short Description: Only required if different from patient.
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: If applicable.
Additional Note: This is likely not required for any Medi-Cal patient, though it could be helpful data to capture for general care coordination / analytics purposes. It is also required for any worker’s compensation claims or any accident-related claims.

Short Description: Full name of the plan.
Additional Note: Similar to other patient / client demographics, validating this information at intake through an eligibility check with the payers database would be a leading practice and a recommended approach.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: If different from patient.
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual thought we should discuss whether there are cases in which this could be a relevant field

Short Description: Street, city, state, ZIP.
Additional Note: Any known address. Need alternate for housing agencies
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: If different from patient.
Additional Note: Medi-Cal eligibility is based on the individual so this likely won’t apply to your patients / clients though we may want to include this as a field in intake forms.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Self, Spouse, Child, Other.
Additional Note: Will always be “self” for Medi-Cal, though we may want to discuss scenarios in which having additional options could be beneficial.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Payer-assigned ID (e.g., Medicare HICN or MBI, Medicaid ID).
Additional Note: This is a vital piece of information and with the correct integration, this can be instantly checked against an eligibility database to confirm, which would be our suggested approach
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Type of health insurance (e.g., Medicare, Medicaid, Other).
Additional Note: This will likely only be Medicaid, though having an option for Medicare would likely be wise, though the default value should be “Medicaid (e.g. Medi-Cal or another state Medicaid plan). This field can also be automatically populated based on the results of an eligibility check.
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Format MM/DD/YYYY
Additional Note: Checking this at the point of registration against the payer’s eligibility database would represent a best practice and would be our recommendation
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management

Short Description: Last name, first name, middle initial.
Additional Note: Checking this at the point of registration against the payer’s eligibility database would represent a best practice and would be our recommendation
Program: CHW, CS: HD, CS: HTNS, CS: HTS, Enhanced Care Management
